headline: Watch: Ohio’s Democratic candidates for governor discuss issues
author: Stephanie Thompson
sentences: As for a similar event with Republican candidates, CMC states, “With two of the three Republican gubernatorial candidates in Ohio announcing they won’t participate in debates, a GOP edition of CMC’s April 20 Democratic forum is unlikely.”

COLUMBUS, Ohio (WCMH) — Ohio Democratic gubernatorial candidates John Cranley and Nan Whaley took part in a candidate conversation moderated by NBC4 anchor Colleen Marshall at the Columbus Metropolitan Club at noon on Wednesday.
The program covered issues facing Ohioans and the candidates’ plans to lead the Buckeye State if elected.
The Democratic winner will face the Republican challenger on the Nov. 8 ballot.
The primary election will take place on May 3.
You can watch the replay of the program above.
